Visit every workshop in the valley.
The Archer has the highest range, but requires accuracy. It is mostly utility and offense focused.
The Assassin is mobile and evasive. It is mostly utility focused.
The Arcanist uses spells and trickery to confuse and evade. It is mostly utility and offense focused.
The Ravager is strong in close quarters or when outnumbered. It is mostly offense focused.
The Phalanx has both good ranged attack potential and a host of support abilities.
The Guardian soaks up damage while disrupting enemies. It is mostly defense focused.
The Elementalist is versatile, with multiple AoE's. It is mostly utility and support focused.
The Ritualist is strong in long engagements, increasing ally's effectiveness. It is mostly support focused.
That's life. Get up and get on with it.
At least the internet is not down.
Now you know one more way how to not do it.
Don't get too cozy. There's still work to do.
This K.O. was brought to you by "The Devs" (tm).
It's not a bug, it's a feature!
I used to be an adventurer like you ...
Shit happens. Keep calm and carry on.
Is there a light at the end of the tunnel?
That's OK. You can't win if you never fail.
No worries. It happens to the best of us.
It can only go up from here.
On the bright side: You're still breathing.
Test time exceeded. You need to buy the game.

Challenge phase

New world area can be unlocked.
The end is near! The dictator was just sighted north of Crossroads. Defeat her!
End of the world: The Dictator
You could not defend your world. But this is not the end. Find a new home and continue your journey.
Your lives are now limited. No new characters can be created.
The jailors are raiding all settlements! Stop them!
End of the world: Jailor Siege
A storm is coming that will destroy everything. Find shelter in the center and defeat the attacking jailors.
This is the end. The storm will claim everything.
End of the world: The Storm
You defeated the dictator and gained a lot of fame. But your world is still dying. Find a new home and continue your journey.
Want to look at your loot? The [I] key opens your character's inventory.
Double-click any item to move it to your inventory, or to equip it from there.
The Global chat can be read by any player on the cluster.
Watch the top of your screen for event notifications. There is always work to do!
Create a clan or invite additional clan members in the clan window [N].
Clan invites pop up in the bottom right. Press [ESC] to accept or deny them.
Meteorites and carcasses are great ways for solo players to earn resources.
Fights over resource areas are less common, but have large rewards for the winner.
A clan settlement gives access to high level training, crafting and secure storage.
Set up a private stash to have a secure storage location for your prized belongings.
Craft a Siege Offering at a workshop to initiate a siege on a player settlement.
Siege Offerings need to be carried to an active siege tent for a siege to start.
Press [C] to view your character's statistics, like run speed or experience level.
Settlements are invulnerable unless sieged. Walls can only be attacked in the last siege phase.
You can customize your ability loadout at any Dojo building.
At a Dojo you can upgrade your abilities or switch to a different weapon or armor.
Collect ability sigils and bring them to a dojo to learn new abilities.
context: Sigil is the new word for what we called [skill] patterns before. They're metal discs used to get skill tattoos.

text: Remember: Damage, healing and crowd control affect ALL players, friend or foe!
Pay attention to the world map [M]. It will show you where events are taking place.
You can cancel any ability while still aiming, or even mid-cast (right-click).
Read your ability's tool tips. They may have more use to them than you realize at first.
Press [K] to learn everything there is to know about your current abilities.
Learn the color and shape of different items and tiers. Know what enemy you face.
The [B] window shows what items you have currently equipped.
Be civil to your opponents. You want to fight them again tomorrow, don't you?
Resources like wood, hemp and clay are used to craft items and build settlements.
There are nine tiers of equipment. Workshops are where you can craft new equipment.
Players get experience from two sources: From activities and Flux items.
Active XP is granted for nearly everything: PvP, PvE, events, crafting and building.
Press [Z] to recall to your bind point when knocked out, or wait for your life to regenerate.
Want to get rid of pesky enemies? Use gank [0] to force them to respawn when knocked out.
You can resurrect any player by using your [8] ability on them.
Being attacked while in menu mode? Pressing [ESC] or moving (WASD) exits all menues.
Need a lofty goal? Collect enough resources to secure your own settlement.
Equip an item by dragging it from your inventory [I] to your equipment [B].
The best items can only be crafted in player-run settlements.
You can only reach the ability cap by training in a player-run settlement.
The mini map (top left) shows arrows that guide you to currently active events.
Invite players to your clan [N] to share XP instead of fighting for last-hits.
Did you know that your character runs slower when moving backwards or to the sides?
You gain a significant speed boost while running on pathways.
Tall grass makes you invisible to other players, but it also slows you down a bit.
Monsters, meteorites, corpses and resource spawns are all good sources of XP.
Want to know where you stand? Press [L] to see the clan leaderboard.
Press [F2] to make screenshots and share them with the community.
Holding [SHIFT] will aim abilities on yourself (useful for self-heals).
To report bugs and give us feedback, press [F3]. You can even send us a screenshot.
You can switch between fullscreen and windowed mode by pressing [F10].
Want to know your ping and FPS? They are right under the mini map.
Lost? You can press [O] to get a nice overview of things to do in the game.
Did you know that higher level equipment has a high chance of dropping when you get knocked out?
Low-level equipment is generally safe from being looted but your inventory never is!
Want to try out a new ability? Find a practice dummy near a dojo.
Only the clan leader can disband your clan or kick a clan member.
Want to become your clan's leader? Ask your friends to elect you [N].
Clan leaders can give normal clan members the rights to invite new people.
Channeled abilities can be canceled at any time by pressing their hotkey again.
When a The Exiled game world ends, it goes into "sudden death" mode where your respawns are limited.
Want to "win" The Exiled? Get the respect of your peers directly or donate to the valley's defense.
Need to say something really fast? Press [V] to open the quick shout menu!
Looting can take a while. Especially when you take from other players.
You can flag yourself as friendly during character creation. Give it a try.
Looking for a clan? You can flag yourself during character creation so that recruiters can find you.
Want to make sure everybody hits the same target? Press [T] to mark a target for your clan!
Found a player that really impressed you? Press [P] and give them your respect!
Press [ENTER] to join the chat, and press [TAB] to swap channels.
Local chat can only be heard by nearby players, and it has chat bubbles!
To use the clan chat you first need to create or join a clan [N].

You cannot move because you carry too much. Drop or trash some items.
(You can securely store your items at a Stash or a Warehouse.)
Donate more resources or this world dies!
This puts you ahead <color=#2ECC4F>{0}%</color> of all other players!

That's it. You lost your last life. Now it's time for a well-deserved break.
Want to watch the end of the fight? You'll find a stream on our website.

<color=#FFB733>Menu Mode</color>
Press <color=#55AEDA>[{{Button.TOGGLE_INPUT_MODE}}]</color> to return to play mode.
While regenerating you gain a set of short buffs.

Skip tutorial. There is no going back.

This is your private stash. Only you have access to it. You can only have one stash. To relocate your stash it must be empty.

Adjust the attributes, keep Balance at zero. Costs are paid from workshop and inventory.

Your weapon and armor class determine the items you can equip and the abilities you can use.

Reagent used in a workshop to increase an item's maximum hit points bonus. This white, chalky stone earns its name from the dark red deposits found in its core. When ground into a paste, it turns blood red.
context: crafting resource, do not translate Tal

text: Reagent used in a workshop to improve the cooldown speed bonus of an item. This yellow powder produces fumes with very little heating and is extremely flammable. It is used for starting fires and as incense.
context: crafting resource, do not translate Tal

text: Reagent used in a workshop to increase an item's bonus resistance to physical damage. This substance forms as a residue on rock faces. It can be dried out to form a dust and is commonly used to embalm corpses.
context: crafting resource, do not translate Tal

text: Reagent used in a workshop to improve the cast speed bonus of an item. When freshly unearthed, this substance has been used to make tonics to improve concentration. If left exposed however, it becomes extremely poisonous.
context: crafting resource, do not translate Tal

text: Material used in settlement construction and to craft equipment at a workshop.

Reagent used in a workshop to increase an item's bonus resistance to magical damage. Exposure to this substance will cause extreme alertness, making sleep virtually impossible for several days. It has been used by war parties for this reason.
context: crafting resource, do not translate Tal

text: Use this in a dojo to improve Assassin and Duelist abilities.
Use this in a dojo to improve Guardian and Skirmisher abilities.
Use this in a dojo to improve Ritualist and Bandit abilities.
Use this in a dojo to improve Archer and Trapper abilities.
Use this in a dojo to improve Ravager and Barbarian Armor abilities.
Use this in a dojo to improve Arcanist and Blade Master abilities.
Use this in a dojo to improve Healer and Phalanx abilities.
Use this in a dojo to improve Elementalist and Martialist abilities.
Reagent used in a workshop to increase an item's maximum energy bonus. This liquid is found in deposits of minerals throughout the valley. It shines like a mirror, and is quite poisonous if ingested.
context: crafting resource, do not translate Tal

text: Reagent used in a workshop to increase an item's running speed bonus. This substance is often used in jewelry due to its beautiful, golden shine. It is also extremely heat conductive, making good quality cooking wares.
context: crafting resource, do not translate Tal

text: Reagent used in a workshop to increase an item's resistance to crowd control bonus. This substance forms in strange, translucent clusters. It is quite fragile, and can be heated to create glues and lubricants.
context: crafting resource, do not translate Tal

text: Can be used (right-click) to gain experience points and level up. Also used in settlement building and crafting recipes.

text: Activate to name this point of interest

, the player you just killed, is new to the game. You can recognize new players by the word <color=#0088ff>NEWCOMER</color> under their name.

Repeatedly killing new players often makes them quit playing before they can become worthy opponents. Consider giving them a chance to learn how to play before being too hard on them.

This will create a bigger player-base for the game and more opponents for you to fight.

Thanks!

The devs
Changes the appearance of the T0 Bow and shows your development support.
Changes the appearance of your character's remains and shows your development support.
Allows you to use the "/dance" command and do the Kickstarter dance.
You can invite one friend to the game.
Grants you the "Harbinger" title in the forums.
Changes the appearance of the T0 leather armor.
Changes the appearance of the T0 leather armor and shows your development support.
Grants you the "Nomad" title in the forums.
Changes the appearance of the T0 robe.
Changes the appearance of the T0 robe and shows your development support.
Changes the appearance of the T0 War Scythe and shows your development support.
Grants you the "Seeker" title in the forums.
Changes the appearance of the T0 splint mail.
Changes the appearance of the T0 splint mail and shows your development support.
Changes the appearance of the T0 Staff and shows your development support.
Allows you to use the "/taunt" command and taunt your enemies.
Changes the appearance of the T0 Totem and shows your development support.
Grants you the "Vanguard" title in the forums.
Boosts your determination for a short time.
Teleports you for a short distance if you hit someone and then stuns multiple targets.
Attack your target with your fists.
Heals targets in an area of effect around you over time. Can be toggled on and off.
Stuns one target while making it invulnerable and invisible. Heals target over time, reduced efficiency on the caster.
Pushes multiple targets away from the you. Speeds you up if you push someone away.
Teleports you in the aimed direction. Passes through players, but not solid objects.
Deals damage in close range and pushes one target away, rooting it for a short time.
Pushes your target away from you, giving you a resistance buff and the target a damage debuff.
Pulls a target towards you, burning it over time.
Rapidly fires five damaging projectiles to the target location. Deals higher damage at range.
Fires dozens of mental projectiles in random directions while making you invulnerable.
Removes all debuffs from a near target. You get healed if a debuff was removed.
Removes non-character entities (walls, traps, turrets) in front of you.
Three shots in rapid succession that deal increasingly more damage. Deals higher damage at range.
Decreases the cooldown speed of everyone around you while active.
Shortly makes you invisible for other players and leaves behind a stationary copy of yours.
Returns the next incoming projectile to its cast location. Roots you in place while active.
Teleports you to a ground target after a delay and mezzes everybody around you when you arrive.
Shot which decreases your targets determination.
Buff that heals you for some of the damage you deal during its duration.
Drains the energy of other players in an area around you, healing you for each enemy drained.
Fast projectile that deals increased damage with every consecutive hit.
Deals high damage around you while pushing targets away.
Creates a wall perpendicular to your view direction.
Heals one target for a large percentage of its maximum health points.
Removes all crowd control effects from a target, pulls it behind you and makes it invulnerable for a short time.
Increases your energy reserves for a while.
Drain energy from your target and speed it up slightly.
Slows down one target at range.
Fast shot that pushes you away from your target if you hit it.
Drops a trap that will explode in a large range when triggered. Will damage you, too.
Burn one target and damage it over time.
Rapidly stab your targets to make them bleed.
Charging attack that deals massive damage to multiple targets in a row. Silences you if you miss. Adds snare/root/stun effects if the target has been hit by Piercing Thrust recently.
Removes roots and snares. Determination and speed boost for each effect removed.
Channel to force a knocked-out player to respawn.
Makes you resistant to mental attacks but more susceptible to physical attacks for a short time.
A slow moving projectile that pulls targets to its location when it lands, slows and debuffs them.
Deals damage in a short range and stuns a target for a short time.
Strong heal that only affects other players, not the caster.
Heals for a small amount on the first hit on another player and for a large amount when hitting the target again.
Heals one target close to your cursor.
Plant a totem that slowly heals many targets, increases their resistance and healing gained.
Pulls a target towards you, healing you if the projectile hits a target.
Turns you or other players invisible for a long time if they don't move too much.
Teleports a player from a position in front of you to behind you and roots that player.
Channeled attack that damages everybody around you.
Slows down your target while damaging it.
You are invulnerable to damage but lose some health over time.
Projectile that explodes at target location, causing massive damage while burning the area.
Short ranged shot that silences your opponent.
Gives you extra health while slowing you down for a while.
Damages your target and prevents it from using abilities for a short time.
Static lightning damages and stuns anybody who comes too close.
Makes you invisible as long as you do not get too close to players or mobs or do anything.
Pulls you to your target. If you miss then you get moved forward a bit.
Medium range projectile that can hit one target (including yourself).
Marks your target and increases its damage from later attacks.
All players behind you take reduced damage for a while while you take more damage.
You sit down and regenerates health fast but get more damage while you sit.
Decreases the target's healing output and increases your mental resistance.
Deals mental damage to one target in close range.
Put up your shield and reflect all projectiles back to their casters.
Short range projectile that damages and slows your target while decreasing its damage output.
Decreases the target's healing output and healing received by a large amount.
Decreases the target's healing received and increases your physical resistance.
Long-ranging melee attack. Adds a debuff that allows Forceful Throw to snare/root/stun your target.
Quick throw that pushes your target back and roots it in place. Stun if target collides with something.
Deals damage over time to one target.
Decreases your cooldown speed for a short time and increases it for the same duration afterwards.
Makes your target invulnerable for a short duration.
Very fast shot that pierces multiple targets and damages them over time.
Deals high damage in short range and roots two targets.
Deals low damage on the first hit but a lot of damage when hitting the target again.
Teleport to your bind point. Can be used when dead. Will drop your inventory items on the ground when used!
Recall failed. You have to confirm within 60 seconds and not move.
Do you really want to recall?
Channel to help a knocked-out player get up again.
Slowly heals one target, increases its resistance and healing gained with reduced effect on yourself.

context: Revive popup. Name of the reviving char comes first.

text: Makes you resistant to physical attacks but more susceptible to mental attacks for a short time.
Deals a lot of damage in close range but hurts you in the process.
Shoot 5 arrows in a fan in front of you.
Sacrifice your own health to heal others around you.
Debuffs an enemy so he gets more damage by incoming attacks for some time.
Briefly silences a target in front of you. Decreases its cast speed and cooldown speed for a while.
Channeled ability that puts a powerblock on anyone in the area around you.
Sets up a smoke screen around you that makes you fully invisible. All other players in the area are snared.
Makes you invisible for a short time. The longer you stay invisible the more damage you deal afterwards.
Shot that deals more damage the further it travels to its target.
Increases all healing done to you and reduces damage done to you and dealt by yourself.
Mezzes one target. If the target is attacked while in Stasis, the attacker will take damage.
Jump to target player. Heals both you and the player.
Reduces one target's damage dealt by a significant amount.
Stuns and damages targets in the area after a short delay.
Swaps your position with your target's and roots them.
Deals physical damage to one target in close range.
Channeled melee attack that deals high damage over time and roots your target.
For a short time you negate the next attack that hits you and instead get healed.
Drops a trap at  which will root a target in place and deal minor damage.
You'll be teleported behind the next target who attacks you, damaging and stunning them.
Increases your energy regeneration and removes the speed penalty for running backwards and side-stepping.
A Pack Animal can be looted
A Pack Animal has fallen nearby
A Meteor has crashed down nearby

context: something is happening for XYZ minutes/hours

text:
Try out different
<color=#FFB733>Armor Classes</color>.
Test abilities
with <color=#2ECC4F>[R]</color> and <color=#2ECC4F>[F]</color>.
Press <color=#2ECC4F>[RClick]</color> to cancel targeting and casting.

Use the <color=#FFB733>Tree</color> on the left
with <color=#2ECC4F>[Space]</color> to
<color=#2ECC4F>Bind</color> yourself to this spawn point.

To equip your new <color=#FFB733>Weapon or Armor</color>
<color=#2ECC4F>[Double Click]</color> it in the inventory <color=#2ECC4F>[I]</color>.
No equipment? First <color=#2ECC4F>Loot</color> resources from <color=#FFB733>Carcass and Meteorite</color>.

Use this <color=#FFB733>Gate</color> to <color=#2ECC4F>Leave</color> the tutorial.
<color=#C22121>There is no going back!</color>
<color=#C22121>Watch out!</color> <color=#FFB733>Footsteps</color> on the ground <color=#2ECC4F>Show</color> that there are others around. They might not be friendly.

<color=#2ECC4F>Use</color> the <color=#FFB733>Bind Point</color>
to pass this gate.

Select your
<color=#FFB733>Weapon and
Armor Class</color>
to pass this gate.

<color=#2ECC4F>Defeat</color> the
<color=#FFB733>Jailor Guard</color>
to pass this gate.
<color=#2ECC4F>Use</color> the jailor guard's <color=#FFB733>key</color> with <color=#2ECC4F>[SPACE]</color> to pass this gate.

Select your
<color=#FFB733>Weapon Class</color>
to pass this gate.

You can <color=#2ECC4F>Hide</color> in these <color=#FFB733>Bushes</color> from players and monsters.
They cannot see you from the outside.
The Archer's bow is very effective at high range, slowing its targets down.

Get sigils and pigments from
monsters to improve and learn new abilities at the Dojo.
context: Sigil is the new word for what we called (skill) patterns before. They're metal discs used to get skill tattoos.

text: The Assassin's leather armor makes you fast, agile and invisible to other players.
The Arcanist's robe makes you a teleporting trickster that confuses other players.
The Reaver's war scythe deals damage in a wide arc. Also pulls in enemies.
The Phalanx uses a long spear to keep enemies at bay and a shield to subdue them.
The Guardian's splint mail allows you to soak up damage and disrupt your enemies.
The Elementalist's staff gives you elemental attacks and healing abilities.
The Ritualist's totem slows and poisons the enemy while healing friends over time.

First <color=#2ECC4F>Loot</color>
materials from <color=#FFB733>Carcasses and Meteorites</color>.
Then <color=#2ECC4F>Craft</color> better
gear at the
<color=#FFB733>Workshop</color>.
This key is required to leave your cell. Have it in your inventory when you use the door (press [SPACE] while mouse cursor is a hand).
Knock out the <color=#FFB733>Sympathetic Jailor Guard</color> and <color=#FFB733>loot</color> the key by pressing <color=#2ECC4F>[SPACE]</color> when hovering over it.
Knock me out, I'll be fine.
I carry the key for the door.
Press SPACE to loot the key from my inventory.
Wow, you have quite a punch.
<color=#2ECC4F>Knock Out</color> the <color=#FFB733>Sympathetic Jailor</color> and <color=#2ECC4F>Use</color> his <color=#FFB733>Key</color> to open the door.
You need to pick one armor class to the left.
You need the jailor's key to open the door.
You need to pick one weapon class to the left.
You need to pick one weapon and one armor class to the left.

Get <color=#FFB733>sigils</color> from
monster to <color=#2ECC4F>Learn</color> new abilities at the Dojo.
context: Sigil is the new word for what we called (skill) patterns before. They're metal discs used to get skill tattoos.

text: Get <color=#FFB733>Pigments</color> from monsters to <color=#2ECC4F>Improve</color> abilities at the Dojo.
Use the nearby <color=#FFB733>barrels</color> with <color=#2ECC4F>[Space]</color> to try outndifferent <color=#FFB733>weapon</color> and <color=#FFB733>armor</color> classes.
Activate the <color=#FFB733>Stash</color> with <color=#2ECC4F>[Space]</color> so you can <color=#2ECC4F>Store</color> your loot safely.

<color=#FFB733>PRIVATE STASH</color>
<color=#2ECC4F>(set up secure private storage here)</color>

Try out different
<color=#FFB733>Weapon Classes</color>.
Test skills with
<color=#2ECC4F>[LClick], [Q]</color> and <color=#2ECC4F>[E]</color>.
Hold <color=#2ECC4F>[Shift]</color> to
target yourself.
Type ABANDON to abandon the settlement and delete everything.

Abandon the settlement. Everything gets destroyed.
